column26: Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencing; RNA-seq of Arabidopsis thaliana seedlings exposed to gamma radiation
column27: RNA-seq of Arabidopsis thaliana seedlings exposed to gamma radiation
column28: Illumina HiSeq 4000 sequencing; RNA-seq of Arabidopsis thaliana seedlings exposed to gamma radiation
column29: Protocols: Shoots of the seedlings were harvested in liquid nitrogen after 48 h gamma exposure and stored at -80°C until analyses. Seeds of the Landsberg erecta (Ler) accession of Arabidopsis thaliana (L) Heyhn, were surface sterilized for 3 min with a solution of 10 mL of 70% ethanol and 10 ul Tween 20, followed by five times wash in distilled water. Seeds were given a quick rinse in 96% ethanol before air drying on a sterile filter paper inside a sterile hood. All seeds were evenly sown on 1/2 MS medium (Murashige & Skoog 1962; Duchefa Biochemie, Harleem, Netherland) with 0.8% agar (Plant agar, Sigma-Aldrich) in  petri dishes of 5 cm diameter. The seeds were then germinated for 6 days at 20°C under a photon flux density of 30 μmol m-2 s-1 at 400-700 nm (TL-D 58W/840 lamps, Phillips) in a 16 h photoperiod. Six days old seedlings were exposed to gamma radiation for 48h at gamma dose rates 1, 10, 40, 100, or 290 mGy/h, using the FIGARO low dose gamma irradiation facility (60Co; 1173.2 and 1332.5 keV γ-rays) at Norwegian University of Life Sciences (Hansen et al. 2019). During the gamma irradiation, the room temperature was set at 20˚C±1°C with a 12 h photoperiod with a photon flux density of 55 μmol m-2 s-1 provided by high pressure metal halide lamps (HPI-T Plus 250W lamps, Phillips). Control samples not exposed to gamma radiation were positioned outside the radiation sector, shielded by lead walls, in the same room and under same light and temperature conditio...

Seeds of the Landsberg erecta (Ler) accession of Arabidopsis thaliana (L) Heyhn, were surface sterilized for 3 min with a solution of 10 mL of 70% ethanol and 10 ul Tween 20, followed by five times wash in distilled water. Seeds were given a quick rinse in 96% ethanol before air drying on a sterile filter paper inside a sterile hood. All seeds were evenly sown on 1/2 MS medium (Murashige & Skoog 1962; Duchefa Biochemie, Harleem, Netherland) with 0.8% agar (Plant agar, Sigma-Aldrich) in  petri dishes of 5 cm diameter. The seeds were then germinated for 6 days at 20°C under a photon flux density of 30 μmol m-2 s-1 at 400-700 nm (TL-D 58W/840 lamps, Phillips) in a 16 h photoperiod. Six days old seedlings were exposed to gamma radiation for 48h at gamma dose rates 1, 10, 40, 100, or 290 mGy/h, using the FIGARO low dose gamma irradiation facility (60Co; 1173.2 and 1332.5 keV γ-rays) at Norwegian University of Life Sciences (Hansen et al. 2019). During the gamma irradiation, the room temperature was set at 20˚C±1°C with a 12 h photoperiod with a photon flux density of 55 μmol m-2 s-1 provided by high pressure metal halide lamps (HPI-T Plus 250W lamps, Phillips). Control samples not exposed to gamma radiation were positioned outside the radiation sector, shielded by lead walls, in the same room and under same light and temperature conditio...
